qas.question: Who was the first pope to meet with an Anglican Archbishop as an official Head of Church since 1960?
Who was Archbishop of Canterbury during Paul VI papacy?
How many times did Archbishop Ramsey meet with Paul VI?
What center did Archbishop Ramsey open in Rome to improve Anglican and Catholic relations?
In what Italian center was the Anglican center opened in by Archbishop Ramsey?

context: <a0_0>Paul VI<a0_0/> was the first pope to receive an Anglican Archbishop of Canterbury, <a1_0>Michael Ramsey<a1_0/> in official audience as Head of Church, after the private audience visit of Archbishop Geoffrey Fisher to Pope John XXIII on 2 December 1960. Ramsey met Paul <a2_0>three<a2_0/> times during his visit and opened the <a3_0>Anglican Centre<a3_0/> in <a4_0>Rome<a4_0/> to increase their mutual knowledge. He praised Paul VI[e] and his contributions in the service of unity. Paul replied that "by entering into our house, you are entering your own house, we are happy to open our door and heart to you." The two Church leaders signed a common declaration, which put an end to the disputes of the past and outlined a common agenda for the future.
